quoteFirst: “What?” Then, as Bert didn’t repeat the observation, he continued disgustedly: “I had him
quoteLast: on the last game and he went out without a break! The balls just rolled everywhere he wanted them to, the lucky stiff! Gee, it would make you sick!”
title: Right Half Hollins

quoteFirst: The range opened to 9,800 yards, and still we were being hit, which clearly showed the efficiency of the German 4.1-inch gun. Our course soon took us out of range, so we again turned towards the enemy, ceasing fire from 5.12 to
quoteLast: This was analogous to the interval that occurred in the battle-cruisers' action, and is significant; both took place on the same day, and both were due to the same cause--namely, the idea of making full use of the heavier armament in our ships, and thus eliminating the risk of incurring unnecessary casualties.
title: The Battle of the Falkland Islands, Before and After
